title: Businesses announce closures ahead of expected wintry precipitation for Omaha area Friday

Businesses announce closures ahead of expected freezing rain, winter weather for Omaha area Friday
Businesses and events have announced closures or cancellations ahead of Friday's forecasted wintry precipitation.A winter weather advisory is in effect from 2 p.m. Friday until 9 a.m. Saturday.Freezing drizzle is expected to start falling around 4 p.m. for the Omaha-area and will continue overnight until it transitions to rain in the early hours of Saturday.Timeline: Wintry precipitation, freezing rain expected Friday for Omaha areaThe Rose Theater's performance of "A Christmas Story: The Musical" is canceled.Boys & Girls Clubs of the Midland will be closing at 6 p.m. Friday.You can find the full list of closings here.Planning out heading out Friday evening? Check the latest road conditions here.Click here for the latest headlines from KETV NewsWatch 7
OMAHA, Neb. —
Businesses and events have announced closures or cancellations ahead of Friday's forecasted wintry precipitation.
A winter weather advisory is in effect from 2 p.m. Friday until 9 a.m. Saturday.
Advertisement
Freezing drizzle is expected to start falling around 4 p.m. for the Omaha-area and will continue overnight until it transitions to rain in the early hours of Saturday.
Timeline: Wintry precipitation, freezing rain expected Friday for Omaha area
The Rose Theater's performance of "A Christmas Story: The Musical" is canceled.
Boys & Girls Clubs of the Midland will be closing at 6 p.m. Friday.
You can find the full list of closings here.
Planning out heading out Friday evening? Check the latest road conditions here.
